value.title: Alibaba’s auto driving lab chief Wang Gang leaves to start his own business
value.excerpt: Wang Gang, a former vice-president with e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding and head of its autonomous driving lab in the DAMO Academy, has quit to start his own business, becoming the latest top scientist to leave a Chinese Big Tech firm.

value.title: Robot tractors may be heading to a farm near you
value.excerpt: Driverless plows and autonomous tools to weed vegetable plots are the latest innovations ready to help farmers juggling labour shortages, climate change and environmental protection, while trying to feed a growing world population.

value.title: AI Weekly: The implications of self-driving tractors and coming AI regulations
value.excerpt: AI regulations are on the way from governments including China. Plus, driverless tractors have reached the market -- with caveats.

value.title: Can AI Emulate Human Creativity?
value.excerpt: AI has undoubtedly made a significant impact on human life but one aspect of it that still causes doubts is creativity. Some believe that creativity and AI cannot go hand in hand, but the truth remains that AI has already begun to take over creative tasks.

value.title: Chinese scientists build factory robot that can read minds

value.title: Ameca the robot is more human (and haunting) than I ever imagined
value.excerpt: If you poke a robot in the face, is it going to try to kill you?  Interviewing Ameca the robot during a demo at CES, I got my answer: No, but the face it makes when you get up in its personal space is haunting and mesmerizing in equal measure.

value.title: Formant raises $18M to help companies manage fleets of robots
value.excerpt: Formant, a startup developing a platform to help manage companies manage fleets of robots, has raised $18 million in venture capital.

value.title: Australian man plans to marry robot after failing to find loving woman
value.excerpt: Australian man wants to marry his expensive AI robot Emma and doesn't want to change anything about their relationship

value.title: Restaurant Robotics Shift to Customer-Facing Roles
value.excerpt: As labor challenges persist, restaurants are looking for solutions, and some tech companies are looking to bring robotics into customer-service roles.

value.title: Why ‘home robots’ are a lot further away than you think

value.title: Seoul Robotics Announces LiDAR Enabled Autonomous Logistics Platform
value.excerpt: The task of transporting cars at the end of the assembly line to its final destination is currently a manual and expensive logistics problem. Seoul Robotics has implemented a LIDAR enabled automation platform to address at BMW Munich plant.

value.title: Logistics Robots Market Size Forecasted to Reach Valuation of USD 14.93 Billion in 2027
value.excerpt: The global logistics robots market size is expected to reach USD 14.93 billion in 2027 and register a CAGR of 15.3% during the forecast period. Increasing online retail trade and e-commerce has resulted in requirement of logistics robots for quick delivery.

value.title: Robo-dogs and therapy bots: Artificial intelligence goes cuddly

value.title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Manufacturing

value.title: Bow down before this US$310,000 massage mega-robot, human

value.title: Machine-Learning Program Connects to Human Brain and Commands Robots
value.excerpt: Researchers at Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne have developed a machine-learning program that can be connected to a human brain and used to command a robot. The program can alter the robot’s movements based on electrical signals from the brain.

value.title: Robotics essential to the oil and gas industry

value.title: Delusional Elon Musk claims Tesla Robot will be ‘like C3PO or R2D2’
value.excerpt: Elon Musk says his upcoming Tesla Robot could make a great buddy -- like C3PO or R2D2. We stopped laughing long enough to write this.
